text: The carboxyl-terminal cytoplasmic domain of <extra_id_0> CD36 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is required for oxidized low - density lipoprotein modulation of NF-kappaB activity by <extra_id_0> tumor necrosis factor-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

The binding of oxidized low - density lipoprotein ( Ox LDL ) by monocyte-macrophages causes pleiotropic effects , including changes in gene expression , and is thought to represent an early event in atherogenesis .

The integral membrane glycoprotein <extra_id_0> CD36 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> appears to play a physiological role in binding and uptake of Ox LDL by monocyte-macrophages , although the molecular events associated with <extra_id_0> CD36 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - Ox LDL interaction are unknown .

To approach this issue , we used <extra_id_0> CD36 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transfected Chinese hampster ovary ( CHO ) cells , exposed them to Ox LDL , and determined changes in the activity of the transcription factor NF-kappaB .

We report here that Ox LDL enhanced DNA binding activity of nuclear extracts to an NF-kappaB sequence following activation of <extra_id_0> CD36 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - producing CHO cells with the proinflammatory cytokine <extra_id_0> tumor necrosis factor-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) .

This enhanced DNA binding activity was inhibited by coincubation of <extra_id_0> CD36 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transfected cells with the human <extra_id_0> CD36 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - specific antibody OKM5 .
We also determined that activation of NF-kappaB DNA binding activity required an intact carboxyl-terminal cytoplasmic segment on <extra_id_0> CD36 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
Our results support the idea that human <extra_id_0> CD36 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mediates signal transduction events in response to Ox LDL .
